KFRCS09004-d-04-26-09-KFR.Contributing Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
KFRCS09004-d-04-26-09-KFR.Narrative: BRAKEMAN STOPPED TO ALIGN THE SOUTH 601 SWITCH TO 600, AFTER ALIGNING THE SWITCH BRAKEMAN DROVE NORTH TO PROTECT THE SHOVE BRINGING BACK THE VALLEY EMPTIES TO SET OUT 4 CARS ON 600 TO STOP AFTER THE NORTH WORK WAS COMPLETED.  BRAKEMAN DIRECTED ENGINEER TO BEGIN THE SHOVE AND CONTINUED THE MOVEMENT UNTIL THE 4 CARS TO BE SET OUT WERE IN THE CLEAR.  BRAKEMAN THEN CUT 4 CARS AND DIRECTED ENGINEER TOPROCEEDED AHEAD TO CONDUCTOR, BRAKEMAN BEGAN TO HANG THE EOT.  AS BRAKEMAN WAS SECURING THE EOT HE HEARD A LOUD CRASH AND INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO STOP.  ON THE INITIAL SOUTH SHOVE THEY RAN THE SWITCH.  AS THEY PROCEEDED NORTH BACK INTO 601 BNSF 723860 SPLIT THE SWITCH AND STRUCK BN 500416 ON TRACK 600  PULLING OFF THE DOORS AND DERAILING THE SOUTH TRUCK AS THE TRAIN PROCEEDED NORTH, BNSF 723892CONTINUED INTO 600 COLLIDING WITH BN 500416 CAUSING IT TO DERAIL AND MAJOR DAMAGE.  THE CARS SPLITAPART AND PLACED THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY STOPPING 100' FROM THE POINT OF IMPACT.

627985-d-04-02-09-CC.Narrative: RHW07-02 WAS PULLING A CUT OF 20 CARS EAST OFF THE HAWTHORNE LEAD COMING OFF OF TRACK HA04.  THE CONDUCTOR WAS AT THE MIDDLE SWITCH GIVING CAR COUNTS TO THE ENGINEER TO STOP THE TRAIN.  THE ENGINEER HEARD COUNTS OF 20-10-5 AND THEN 2 CARS TO GO AND STATED THAT HE FULLY APPLIED THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE.THE CONDUCTOR SAID THAT WILL DO.  AFTER MOVING ABOUT 5 MORE CAR LENGTHS, THE ENGINEER GRABBED A FULL SERVICE ON THE AUTOMATIC TO APPLY MORE BRAKING.  AFTER A FEW MORE CAR LENGTHS, THE ENGINEER PUT THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY BUT STILL COULD NOT STOP THE TRAIN.  ENGINE CN 4028 SLID INTO TRAIN M33791-02 THAT WAS ON #4 MAIN DAMAGING CN 40657 & IC 504675.  THE ENGINEER FAILED TO CONTROL THE CARS AND DID NOT STOP SHORT OF TRAIN M33791-02 RAKING 2 CARS ON M33791-02 WITH ENGINE.  THERE WERE NO INJURIESOR HAZARDOUS MATERIALS INVOLVED AND NOTHING WAS DERAILED.  THE ENGINEER WAS TESTED, ALL RESULTS WERENEGATIVE.

DBUX 302059, STCC 4909152, UN 1987, RELEASED 2 LIQUID QUARTS OF ALCOHOLS, N.O.S. DUE TO THELARGE AMOUNT OF ABRASION, THE CAUSE OF THE RAIL BREAK COULD NOT BE DETERMINED WITH CERTAINTY.  IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THIS DERAILMENT BE CLOSED OUT WITH CAUSE CODE T299 OTHER RAIL AND JOINT BAR DEFECT.

628119-d-04-05-09-IC.Narrative: R92871-04 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING AT PRESIDENT'S ISLAND WHEN THEY SWITCHED THE CRGX 4632 TOTHE NEW YARD TRACK. CRGX 4632ROLLED BACK AND SIDESWIPED THE CARS ROLLING DOWN THE LEAD.  THE CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE A DEFECTIVE HAND BRAKE ON CRGX 4632.  EQUIPMENT DAMAGED: CRGX 4632, NAHX 58437, GPFX 11372. OP042209WT-d-04-22-09-WTJR.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
OP042209WT-d-04-22-09-WTJR.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
OP042209WT-d-04-22-09-WTJR.Narrative: CREW WAS PULLING THE YARD TRACKS.  THE 4367 PULLED THE 100 EMPTY STORAGE CARS FROM THE MAINLINE.  CREW HAD A JOB BRIEFING AND DECIDED TO FILL TRACK 6, THEN TRACK 5 AND THEN SET THE REMAINDER INTO TRACK 8.  AFTER WATCHING THE SHOVE ON TRACK 6 SUPERVISOR MOVED TO TRACK 5 EAST END TO WATCH THE SHOVE ONTHAT TRACK.  SUPERVISOR HEARD CONDUCTOR TELL ENGINEER TO PULL AHEAD AFTER CUTTING OFF TRACK 6.  SUPERVISOR WAITED `A FEW MINUTES` AND THEN ASKED ENGINEER IF HE WAS MOVING BECAUSE SUPERVISOR SAW NO MOVEMENT.  ENGINEER REPLIED YES, AT 4.5 MPH.  AT THAT TIME CONDUCTOR ASKED SUPERVISOR IF HE WAS WATCHING TRACK 8.  SUPERVISOR SAID NO, WE ARE SUPPOSED TO BE SHOVING TRACK 5.  SUPERVISOR DROVE OVER TO TRACK 8 AND OBSERVED THREE CARS ON THE GROUND AND 2 CARS ON THEIR SIDES.

09041601D-d-04-16-09-WSOR.Primary Accident Cause: Kicking or dropping cars, inadequate precautions
09041601D-d-04-16-09-WSOR.Accident Cause: Kicking or dropping cars, inadequate precautions
09041601D-d-04-16-09-WSOR.Narrative:
2 CARS WERE KICKED WEST ONTO 4 CARS THAT WERE STANDING ON THE DOUBLE ENDED INDUSTRIAL SIDING.  ALL 6CARS THEN ROLLED WESTBOUND THROUGH THE DOUBLE ENDED INDUSTRIAL SIDING, THROUGH THE SWITCH, AND COUPLED INTO AN OLD ENGINE AND 9 CARS THAT WERE PARKED AT THE END OF TRACK AWAITING DISMANTLING/DISPOSAL.  LOADED COVERED HOPPER ACFX 51525 WAS THE CAR LEADING THE MOVEMENT OF THE FREE ROLLING CARS.  ENGINE NRE 1 WAS LEADING THE CUT OF EQUIPMENT THAT WAS PARKED AT THE END OF TRACK.  ACFX 51525 COUPLED INTO THE NRE 1 AT APPROXIMATELY 15 MPH, DAMAGING AND DERAILING BOTH, AND CAUSING EMPTY COVERED HOPPERCAR DDNX 603131 TO GO INTO THE DIRT PILE AND DERAIL AT THE END OF TRACK.  ACFX 51525 WAS RERAILED AND REPAIRED.  OTHER EQUIPMENT WAS LEFT IN PLACE TO CONTINUE TO AWAIT DISMANTLING/DISPOSAL. 

TRACKDENISITY SHOWN IN BOX 23 ABOVE IS FOR THE SUBDIVISION THAT TERMINATES AT CAMBRIA.  AS THE INCIDENTTOOK PLACE AT THE END OF TRACK, THE MAJORITY OF THE TONNAGE SHOWN IN BOX 23 TERMINATES JUST EAST OFTHE LOCATION OF THE INCIDENT. 
 
DAMAGE TO IN SERVICE EQUIPMENT (ACFX 51525) AMOUNTED TO $2558.  DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT (NRE 1 AND DDNX 603131) NOT OWNED BY A RAILROAD BUT STORED ON RAIL FOR PLANNED DISMANTLING/DISPOSAL IS ESTIMATED AT $11500.

628216-d-04-05-09-IC.Narrative: R93791-05 WAS PULLING NORTHWARD WITH 44 CARS TO CLASSIFY.  THE CREW OPERATING LONG-HOOD NORTH ON GTW4908 WITH ALL CREW MEMBERS OCCUPYING THE CAB.  UPON ARRIVING AT THE GL41/GL51 SWITCH THE ENGINEER NOTICED THE ERGONOMICAL SWITCH HANDLE IN THE VERTICAL POSITION AND PLACED THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY.THE CREW FAILED TO STOP SHORT OF THE IMPROPERLY LINED SWITCH THAT RESULTED IN THE DERAILMENT OF A LOCOMOTIVE AND TWO CARS.  UPON FURTHER INSPECTION OF THE OTHER SWITCHES IN D-YARD SEVEN HANDLES WERE FOUND IN VERTICAL POSITIONS.  THE CREW WAS REASONABLE TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  EQUIPMENT DERAILED: GTW 4908, UTLX 671783, QCCX 2258 CAR UTLX 671783 WAS DAMAGED FURTHER WHILE HULCHER WAS RERAILING IT.  A TRESPASSER WAS SPOTTED BY THE TRAINMASTER AND CN POLICE RESPONDED, HOWEVER THE TRESPASSER WAS NOT FOUND.  THE CN POLICE ARE INCREASING PATROLS IN THE AREA.

0409HO028-d-04-20-09-UP.Narrative: THE BRAKEMAN ON LHU03-20 WAS RIDING A CAR OUT OF THE BAKER PETROLITE CORP., AN INDUSTRY.
